sub_title: Senior Policy Officer @ Ministry of Social Affairs and Employment | MSc. Cultural Anthropology
summary:
Hello! Looking for someone who is organised, process- and goal-oriented, enjoyes making new connections and has a heart for people? Let's connect! 📧

Last year I made the switch from private to public sector. I am happy to now combine my gained leadership and operational skills, and the anthropologist in me, in my role as senior policy officer at the Ministry of Social Affairs and Employment. In this role I help to find ways to ensure people who loose their job are able to return to the jobmarket or how they can receive the required social benefits if needed. I focus mainly on the prevention of fraud with unemployment benefits. 

From a young age, I have been interested in making connections with others and explore the world. After I completed a bachelor's in Sustainable Tourism Development, I wanted to learn more about the cross-cultural subjects I studied. So I completed a master's in Cultural Anthropology and graduated by completing 3 months of fieldwork in Mauritius researching the social-cultural impact of tourism. 

Over the last 10+ years, I have gained strong leadership and coaching skills, while working in a fast-paced international environment in a variety of finance operations roles 👩🏼‍💻 within the financial service industry. My can-do attitude and down-to-earth personality enable me to get the job done. I am client-focused, efficient, very dedicated, and loyal when working on the right cause. Next to that, I have strong influencing and problem-solving skills by applying emotional intelligence. I am a good mediator because of my communication skills and intercultural sensitivity. I completed various strategic initiatives by using my analytical mindset and have worked with clients and colleagues worldwide. I value strong work relationships and enjoy working with, in, and coaching diverse teams. 

I have heart for and drive to focus on employee engagement, well-being, diversity, and inclusion. 
Interested in exchanging thoughts? Please feel free to reach out for a chat or coffee ☕.

Thank you! 🙏

Specialties:
Policy making | Cross-Cultural Awareness | International Work Experience | Employee Health & Well-being | Diversity & Inclusion | Qualitative Research | Strategic Initiatives | Sustainable Tourism Development | Cultural Anthropology | Financial Services | Factoring | Accounts Receivable & Payable | Syndication | Analytical Analysis | Financial Planning & Analysis | Customer Relationship Management | Global Team Management | Coaching & Mentoring |  Adaptive Leadership |  Employee Engagement

profile_positions.description:

profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Officer

profile_positions.description:
• Manage and coordinate onbook monetization (factoring) and offbook syndication for EMEA and ASIA (±265 clients) and support NAM to generate cash flow for GE Industrials.
• Primary point of escalation for internal stakeholder and client communication with regards to audits, analytical analysis, reconciliations. Provide client training and solutions for challenges.
• Coordinate and oversee client issue resolution globally, with a report out to Senior Leaders.
• Maintain investor relationships with external banks and provide regular updates on the status of the portfolio.
• Manage the client funding and syndication analysts (onsite and offshore, 7 FTE) and keep oversight of the global operational process (coaching, setting team- and individual priorities). 
• Drive standardization and process rigor, lead and support process enhancements and simplification initiatives (including system changes and automation projects) by applying LEAN. Led automation of funding approvals by writing specifications, consulting developers, and completing UAT (User Acceptance Testing).
• Manage planning and ensure timely execution of the client funding processes (treasury forecasts, Sharia-compliant process, jurisdictional requirements such as Law 136 in Italy and notary requirements in Mexico).
• Prepare quarterly financial reports and ad-hoc report requests and support audit requests.
• Support with NPI's, integration, and migration projects as SME (Subject Matter Expert). Received a CFO award for my critical role for a new Pan-European alternative funding structure that went live in September 2018, leveraging GE trade receivables of $ 1.5 Billion quarterly. I remained responsible for providing the quarterly pre-funding analytics to facilitate external investor funding.
profile_positions.title: Monetization Operations Manager - International

profile_positions.description:
In addition to my day-to-day business responsibilities, I have held an active role within GE in social impact & engagement work: 
• 2020: Member of the GE Capital Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) Council. Coordinate dialogue to receive feedback on DEI experiences (for example, implicit bias) and actively support the development of a framework. My efforts were recognized with a CEO award in November 2020.
• March 2013 - December 2020: HealthAhead Champion Breda site. Organise events for co-workers and family members on-site and globally. Maintaining site budget, coaching the team to ensure activities were held, metrics were met for certification, and VOC surveys were completed to improve the program. In Breda, I worked together with the Women’s Network, Engagement Team & LGBT Network. Areas of focus: Eat Well; Screen, Educate & Prevent; Get Active; Find Balance; Tobacco and Other Harmful Substances.
• September 2011 – February 2013: Engagement Agent WCS Breda. Leading the site engagement team; budget control; organizing events for co-workers, both on and offsite, including year-end party.
• 2013 – 2020: Member of the site-safety team. Ensure people follow regulations around safety and emergency response in and outside the office.
profile_positions.title: Engagement Agent, HealthAhead Champion, Diversity & Inclusion Enabler

profile_positions.title: Funding Integrations Lead

profile_positions.description:

• Prepare the Monthly Funding Schedule to ensure timely funding taking into account jurisdictional requirements, treasury forecast, sales accruals and bank cutoffs. 
• Interface with cross functional teams and support integration and migration projects. 
• Communicate & work frequently with key factoring clients. 
• Analysis of the total factoring process & results. 
• Led multiple developments like the Italian Law 136 system requirements and value date change implementation by writing specifications and completing UAT (User Acceptance Testing).
profile_positions.title: Client Funding Analyst

profile_positions.title: Buy to Pay Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Qualitative research, among the local population, tourism industry and governmental organisations, on the social-cultural effects of tourism development. The results of my research are presented in my Master thesis: “Mauritian melting-pot: act of fact? The social-cultural effects of tourism development”. 

This thesis gives more inside in the social-cultural effects of tourism under the population of small islands such as Mauritius who are economically heavily depended on tourism. Tourism has both positive and negative effects on the local population of a tourism destination. Mauritius is promoted by different actors involved in the tourism industry, as a melting pot where past and present are smoothly blended together. By promoting the country as a melting-pot of cultures, people can act upon this image by turning culture into a commodity or by staging authenticity. We can conclude that in Mauritius people are both united and divided. At one side there is a clear nationalistic ‘melting-pot’ policy. Hereby the goal is the formation of unity and identity across non-ethnic lines. At the other side, we can speak of a ‘cultural mosaic’ where symbolic expressions of ethnicity are being recognized, celebrated and encouraged by the government. Tourism has become one of the main economic resources in Mauritius, next to the sugarcane, financial service and textile industry.
profile_positions.title: Fieldwork Master Cultural Anthropology

profile_positions.description:

profile_positions.company: NHTV Breda University of Applied Sciences
profile_positions.description: For my thesis I went to Wisconsin for 3 weeks and interviewed people working for local festivals, local tourist shops, local entrepreneurs and the tourism board. During my stay I took an “internship” of 5 days at the Wisconsin Department of Tourism. The results of my research are presented in my Bachelor thesis: “Festival tourism: a tool to sustainable local economic development? Example of Milwaukee”.
profile_positions.title: Research Bachelor Thesis

profile_positions.description: Research on the development of tourism. By getting in touch with the local population, local organisations and government, we gained knowledge about the developments and future perspectives. Conclusions presented in a “Destination analysis” report.

volunteer_experiences.description: Within GE Capital, I got selected as buildOn Ambassador. Before the trek in May 2015, I organized, together with 14 colleagues, fundraising activities to reach the funds ~60K $ needed to build a new primary school in Malawi. In May 2015, we constructed, together with the local community, the foundations of the school. The locals completed the construction. During our stay, we stayed with local families. For a few years, I led fundraising activities on-site for other treks.
Volunteered for 3 years at Pinkpop Festival. I had the first morning shift on the campsite. I helped visitors with their questions.
